"Unlimited PTO" as a "benefit" for employees is BS.

Here's why...AND a way better idea FOR EMPLOYEES & COMPANIES...

When a company offers "Unlimited PTO" it does two things: 

1) studies show employees actually take less PTO when this is offered compared to traditional models (i.e. 14 days PTO)

and...

2) employees don't "accrue PTO hours" so they are not paid out on them at the end of the year if not taken

What is a WAY BETTER OPTION FOR EVERYONE? 

Offer them the ability to WORK REMOTE. Stats here...

By working from home, employees: 

1) Get a whopping 98 WORKING DAYS of time back each year that is normally spent getting ready, commuting, and in unnecessary meetings/convos (3 hrs/day x 261 working days a year = 783 hrs back to employees)

2) Spend 4%+ more time per day on core work!

Which means more time spent on critical projects AND a crazy amount of time back to each person, every day! ...not to mention all the commercial RE savings for companies and home office write offs for employees :) 

....so post COVID, let's keep this whole WFH thing going  (and also offer Unlimited PTO :)) if you really want to attract top talent and get more done!
